text: The 2016 Vuelta a Asturias was the 59th edition of the Vuelta a Asturias cycling stage race. The race included three stages: it started on 30 April with a stage from Oviedo to Alto del Acebo (Cangas del Narcea) and finished on 2 May with a stage that started in Bueño and then finished back in Oviedo. The defending champion was Igor Antón (). The race was won by Hugh Carthy (), who won a solo victory on the first stage and then finished in the third position on the last stage to secure victory by 22 seconds. == Teams == A total of 14 teams and one national combined team raced in the 2016 Vuelta a Asturias: one UCI World Team, another UCI Professional Continental team and 12 UCI Continental teams. == Schedule == The race included three road stages on consecutive days. {| class="wikitable" |- !Stage !Date !Course !Distance !colspan="2"|Type !Winner |- !style="text-align:left"|1 |align=right|30 April||Oviedo to Alto del Acebo|| style="text-align:center;"| || link=||Mountain stage | |- !style="text-align:left"|2 |align=right|1 May || Cangas del Narcea to Pola de Lena || style="text-align:center;"| || link=||Medium-mountain stage | |- !style="text-align:left"|3 |align=right|2 May || Bueño to Oviedo || style="text-align:center;"| || link=||Medium- mountain stage | |- | colspan="2" style="text-align:center;"| Total | colspan="5" style="text-align:center;"| |} == Stages == === Stage 1 === 30 April – Oviedo to Alto del Acebo, {| |- || || |} === Stage 2 === 1 May – Cangas del Narcea to Pola de Lena, {| |- || || |} === Stage 3 === 2 May – Bueño to Oviedo, {| |- || || |} == Classifications == The race included four principal classifications, the leaders of which wore jerseys. The leader in the general classification wore a blue jersey; the leader in the points classification wore a blue jersey; the leader in the mountains classification wore a green jersey; the leader of the intermediate sprints classification wore a black and white jersey. {| class=wikitable style="text-align: center; font-size:smaller;" |- ! style="width:1%;"| Stage ! style="width:14%;"| Winner ! style="width:14%;"| General classification ! style="width:14%;"| Points classification ! style="width:14%;"| Mountains classification ! style="width:14%;"| Intermediate sprint classification ! style="width:14%;"| Youth classification ! style="width:14%;"| Teams classification |- | 1 |Hugh Carthy |style="background:lightblue;" rowspan=3| Hugh Carthy |style="background:lightgreen;" | Hugh Carthy |style="background:lightyellow" rowspan=3| Raúl Alarcón |style="background:lightgrey;" rowspan=3| Diego Milán |style="background:orange;" rowspan=3| Hugh Carthy |rowspan=3| |- | 2 | Carlos Betancur |style="background:lightgreen;" | Sergio Pardilla |- | 3 | Daniel Moreno |style="background:lightgreen;" | Daniel Moreno |- ! colspan=2| Final ! style="background:blue;"| Hugh Carthy ! style="background:green;"| Daniel Moreno ! style="background:white;"| Raúl Alarcón ! style="background:black;"| Diego Milán ! style="background:darkorange;"| Hugh Carthy ! style="background:offwhite;"| |} == References == == External links == * Official website Category:Vuelta a Asturias Asturias, Vuelta a Asturias, Vuelta a
